# Software Requirements Specification
## Traffic Monitoring and Object Detection System

*Auto-generated by Compliance Coder V-Model Engine*
*Generated: 2026-01-11T11:20:39.178Z*

---

## Document Overview

This document specifies the software requirements for Traffic Monitoring and Object Detection System.
Requirements are derived from analyzed code functionality and follow ASPICE SWE.1 standards.

**Traceability:** REQ → ARCH → DESIGN → CODE (each level traces to adjacent levels)

## Requirements


### REQ-001: Real-Time Object Detection Accuracy

**Priority:** critical
**Feature:** F1

**Description:**
The system shall detect and classify vehicles in video frames with an accuracy of at least 90% under varying traffic conditions.

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- Criterion 1 - The system shall achieve a precision of at least 90% when evaluating a dataset of 1000 annotated video frames.
- Criterion 2 - The system shall maintain a recall rate of at least 90% for vehicle detection across different lighting and weather conditions.

**Traceability (SWE.1):**
- Architecture Components: ARCH-001
- Verified by (System Tests): SYS-TEST-001

---


### REQ-002: Real-Time Processing Speed

**Priority:** critical
**Feature:** F1

**Description:**
The system shall process video frames and provide detection results in real-time with a latency of no more than 100 milliseconds per frame.

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- Criterion 1 - The system shall demonstrate an average processing time of 100 milliseconds or less per frame during a continuous video stream.
- Criterion 2 - The system shall handle a minimum input frame rate of 30 frames per second without dropping frames.

**Traceability (SWE.1):**
- Architecture Components: ARCH-002
- Verified by (System Tests): SYS-TEST-002

---


### REQ-003: User Interface for Detection Results

**Priority:** critical
**Feature:** F1

**Description:**
The system shall display detected vehicles and their classifications on the user interface in real-time.

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- Criterion 1 - The system shall visually overlay bounding boxes and labels on detected vehicles within 100 milliseconds of detection.
- Criterion 2 - The system shall update the user interface in real-time without noticeable lag when new vehicles are detected.

**Traceability (SWE.1):**
- Architecture Components: ARCH-002
- Verified by (System Tests): SYS-TEST-003

---


### REQ-004: Traffic Class Logging

**Priority:** high
**Feature:** F2

**Description:**
The system shall log detected traffic classes and their counts in a structured format.

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- The system shall record each detected traffic class along with its count in a log file.
- The log file shall be accessible for analysis and shall be in a format compatible with standard data analysis tools (e.g., CSV or JSON).

**Traceability (SWE.1):**
- Architecture Components: ARCH-003
- Verified by (System Tests): SYS-TEST-004

---


### REQ-005: Log Timestamping

**Priority:** high
**Feature:** F2

**Description:**
The system shall timestamp each entry in the traffic class log.

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- Each log entry shall include a timestamp indicating when the traffic class was detected.
- The timestamp format shall comply with ISO 8601 standards.

**Traceability (SWE.1):**
- Architecture Components: ARCH-005
- Verified by (System Tests): SYS-TEST-005

---


### REQ-006: Log Retention Policy

**Priority:** high
**Feature:** F2

**Description:**
The system shall implement a log retention policy for traffic class logs.

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- The system shall retain logs for a minimum of 30 days before automatic deletion.
- The system shall provide a mechanism to manually archive or delete logs prior to the retention period.

**Traceability (SWE.1):**
- Architecture Components: ARCH-005
- Verified by (System Tests): SYS-TEST-006

---


### REQ-007: Real-Time Notification Delivery

**Priority:** high
**Feature:** F3

**Description:**
The system shall deliver notifications to users within 2 seconds of detecting a vehicle class and its count.

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- Notifications are received by the user within the specified time frame of 2 seconds for at least 95% of detection events.
- Notifications include the detected vehicle class and the corresponding count.

**Traceability (SWE.1):**
- Architecture Components: ARCH-002
- Verified by (System Tests): SYS-TEST-007

---


### REQ-008: Notification Content Accuracy

**Priority:** high
**Feature:** F3

**Description:**
The system shall ensure that the content of the notifications accurately reflects the detected vehicle classes and their counts.

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- The notification content matches the actual detected vehicle classes and counts for 100% of the test cases.
- The system shall log all detection events and their corresponding notifications for audit purposes.

**Traceability (SWE.1):**
- Architecture Components: ARCH-006
- Verified by (System Tests): SYS-TEST-008

---


### REQ-009: User Notification Preferences

**Priority:** high
**Feature:** F3

**Description:**
The system shall allow users to configure their notification preferences for vehicle detection events.

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- Users can enable or disable notifications through the settings interface.
- The system shall respect user preferences, sending notifications only when enabled, for 100% of the test cases.

**Traceability (SWE.1):**
- Architecture Components: ARCH-003
- Verified by (System Tests): SYS-TEST-009

---


### REQ-010: Custom Mapping Definition

**Priority:** medium
**Feature:** F4

**Description:**
The system shall allow users to define custom mappings for detected traffic classes through a user interface.

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- The user can input a custom mapping for each detected traffic class.
- The system shall save the custom mappings and retain them after a restart.

**Traceability (SWE.1):**
- Architecture Components: ARCH-004
- Verified by (System Tests): TBD

---


### REQ-011: Mapping Validation

**Priority:** medium
**Feature:** F4

**Description:**
The system shall validate custom mappings to ensure they conform to predefined rules.

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- The system shall reject mappings that contain invalid characters or formats.
- The system shall provide an error message to the user for any invalid mapping attempt.

**Traceability (SWE.1):**
- Architecture Components: TBD
- Verified by (System Tests): TBD

---


### REQ-012: Mapping Application

**Priority:** medium
**Feature:** F4

**Description:**
The system shall apply the custom mappings to the detected traffic classes in real-time.

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- The system shall reflect the custom mappings in the traffic class display immediately after they are defined.
- The system shall correctly route detected traffic according to the custom mappings without delay.

**Traceability (SWE.1):**
- Architecture Components: TBD
- Verified by (System Tests): TBD

---


### REQ-013: Environment Setup Functionality

**Priority:** medium
**Feature:** F5

**Description:**
The system shall provide a function to initialize the development environment by setting up necessary configurations and dependencies.

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- The function shall successfully configure the environment without errors when called with valid parameters.
- The function shall log the setup process, indicating success or failure for each step.

**Traceability (SWE.1):**
- Architecture Components: TBD
- Verified by (System Tests): TBD

---


### REQ-014: Model Download Utility

**Priority:** medium
**Feature:** F5

**Description:**
The system shall provide a utility function to download necessary models from a specified repository.

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- The utility shall download the models within 5 minutes under normal network conditions.
- The utility shall verify the integrity of the downloaded models using checksums.

**Traceability (SWE.1):**
- Architecture Components: TBD
- Verified by (System Tests): TBD

---


### REQ-015: Error Handling in Setup Utilities

**Priority:** medium
**Feature:** F5

**Description:**
The system shall handle errors gracefully during the environment setup and model download processes.

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- The system shall provide meaningful error messages for at least 95% of potential failure scenarios.
- The system shall not crash and shall return to a stable state after encountering an error.

**Traceability (SWE.1):**
- Architecture Components: TBD
- Verified by (System Tests): TBD
